Essay: Why I am here?: Reflection #1: Why Am I Here?   “Why am I here?” is quite a general question that can be taken in many directions, but I assume   that it is intended for us to make our connections to this class. For me personally, I am taking   physics 101 and 102, because as a kinesiology major it is something that we need to know in our   field of study. More specifically, my goal is to become a sports physical therapist and work to   rehabilitate athletes, so dealing with physics and its relationship with the human body is going to   be a big component of my job. Sports have always been a big part of my life ever since I was in   elementary school and I have played in a couple basketball leagues growing up. This fascination   with sports turned into an interest in health and fitness as well, which led me down the path of   kinesiology. Particularly, it was all the injuries that I have been through over the years that really   made me want to become a physical therapist and help others who may be going through any   injuries they may experience in their lifetime.

I am here because my future goal is to heal people. I am taking this course as a prereq for the   Kin major. I would like to become a physical therapist, specifically for athletes. I am very   passionate about sports and being in that atmosphere will keep me motivated and able to   understand the physical and mental struggles that athletes go through.

Reflection: At the moment I am feeling very stressed. I have a lot of things to coordinate such as school, my jons, and practicing soccer in my off time. My family has also been bugging me with orders and questions that I don’t have the answers for. It is not so bad though, I have no health issues and I just got a new tattoo. This school year has been quite an interesting one with having so much zoom involved in my everyday life now. I never imagined my first year at a university like this, but here we are. I hope the virus becomes more manageable soon and we can all pursue the things we like doing again. I feel like that would take a lot of stress off everyone’s shoulders and more money in their pockets hopefully. Being in the house this much is a struggle ,but again it could always be worse.

Holly Enrile PHYSICS LAB Reﬂection#1 Sept. 10, 2020 I am here because it is a requirement for my major and I think Physics is a really cool subject to learn. To have knowledge about the way things work and relate to each other is a powerful skill.  In general, I’m in school because I want to make my parents proud and break the generational cycle. I will be ﬁrst generation university graduate. I am also a mother of 2 who I want to set a good example for and that hard work does and will pay oﬀ. There will be many obstacles, especially during this time with all the stuﬀ going in the world today but with grit and growth mindsets, we all can persevere and get through it.

Become a nurse has always been my dream job and I hope to make it real even though sometimes is hard to keep going but not impossible.

Why am I here? I am here in this lab because, honestly, there wasn’t any other lab that was available for me to take. And to be honest, I am here because there is nothing else for me to do besides work, especially because of the whole pandemic situation that is going on, this helps to further progress my study, as well as help occupy my time.

Jose Castillo       Reflection     Honestly I’m only here because is part of my requirement for my major. The reason I believe that I am here is to help people, I believe that I was gifted with an extreme   level of compassion for people and a strong desire to serve the populus I believe the best way   that I can do that is through medicine and learning about the body. While attending school and   pursuing higher education I believe that I can help people by teaching them the foundations of   healthy choices and habits and how to maintain health in order to achieve confidence in their   own frames. From a young age I always had a passion for health and fitness and this has   evolved into a passion for health and medicine later on in my life. My approach to medicine is a   holistic approach which I believe is the best approach because it doesn’t solely focus on   prescribing medication and sending people on their ways, rather it focuses on pushing health   and taking care of the person as a whole in order to ensure that I left them better then when   they came to me rather than just temporarily fixing one problem while inducing another one.

I am here because I am a pre-kinesiology major and it is a prerequisite for my major. I hope to get knowledge from this class that will better prepare myself for the kinesiology courses I will be needing to take next school year. I am trying to get all my general education courses as well as a few pre-requisite courses because I am also interested in getting a business minor, so I need to try to get everything out of the way as soon as possible to be able to graduate on time and hopefully get into a graduate physical therapy school.

I think the reason that I am here is to complete my physics classes. I took the lecture last   semester and I did just fine in that class, although it sucked that I had to finish that class online.   That is what screwed my grade up last minute. Other than that I don’t know why I am here other   than that. I do like physics, at least basic physics, and if I were to pursue a higher level of   physics with trigonometry and things like that, my brain would honestly explode. But taking this   level of physics isn’t too bad. I’m excited to see what is in store for this lab. I should be able to   apply what I learned from last semester into this class and maybe help some people out if they   are stuck. 5 minutes to talk about why I think I am here.. Uhh, OH I would like to be able to   apply the labs into real life especially because I think this lab would help me in my major which   is Kinesiology. I think being able to apply that into the field of Kinesiology would be huge   because we study range of motion and the movements of the body.

I am in physics 101/102 to learn about physics, and how the natural world around me works. This could help me simply better understand every day experiences but ultimately will help me in my future career as a physical therapist. Under standing motion, gravity, velocity, rebound, etc. will help me safely help people rehabilitate using the movement of their bodies, and various fitness equipment. I’m at SFSU because I want a degree. I’ve been in the workforce on the recruitment side, and in the Bay Area I see how recruiters skim resumes, and if a degree isn’t on there, they go to the bottom of the pile. The few people who make it through on experience alone typically get paid less, and even more so if they’re female. I want a degree in kinesiology because I want to pursue becoming a physical therapist. What attracts me most about physical therapy is the job description includes many of the things I like and the skills I have proficiency in, as well as allows for my failings. I love working one on one with people, but I also have a hard time with doing the 9-5 gig. I need flexible hours. I need both structure and freedom. Clear instructions of what I should/shouldn’t do, but then to be allowed to do so without micromanagement. Point and case, my cat sitting on my printer glaring at me because he wants something from me. He thinks I’m here to feed, pet, or amuse him, at his discretion only.

Why am I here? I am here in this class because it is a pre requisite for my major. I guess in the grand scheme of things I am just here on this by chance. I think I am just the sum of all these random chances and probabilities. I also think I am here based on my past experiences. If I hadn’t taken one speciﬁc class in high school by chance then I would not be pursuing the career I am right now. I also think I would not be here at this school to even be taking this class in the ﬁrst place. I think I am here from a combination of chances and choices.

I am here before of my family; I want to make them proud showing them my accomplishments and being the best, I can. Learning about that and being able to help another person life is success and providing for the community around.

Week 3 Reflection:   Why am I here?     College is a place where you can further your knowledge and learn new skills. Emily Pham     09/10/20   Physics 102   Reflection     I am here because I wish to learn more about how the world works in a way. I   didn’t realize it before but physics requires gathering lots of data which is pertinent to   many other scenarios. Other scenarios that require gathering evidence would be cops,   forensic scientists, and much more because at the end of the day you need evidence to   back up the claim that you’re making. Physics is so essential to us in even the smallest   ways yet we don’t even realize it because we typically assume that physics is such a   complicated concept about motion. However, the reality is that the field of physics is   quite versatile because it’s a mixture of using our knowledge/common sense with new   information to solve a question. I used to actually brush off the idea of doing anything   related to physics because I always thought of it as a confusing concept about how things   move or happen.

Why am I here?  I think I am here because I am passionate about connecting with people. I try and make small connections and interactions as personal as I can in hopes of creating a bond that can create joy in my life. There is really nothing comparable to the feeling of just bonding with someone and feeling as though your two personalities are perfect together. Relationships are incredibly important to me. I have friends now that I’ve known since the 7th grade because we all value the strong bond that we have created together. Having people that I know I can rely on for anything at any time provides me with a sense of security that I feel is impossible to find in other things. The amount of genuine joy and fulfillment I get from existing in the same time period as some of my amazing friends and family really is what drives me in life… and I think that’s why I am here.

Elena Mena  “Why am I here”   I am here because this is a required class for my major. I am a kinesiology major and physics is one of the required classes to take. I have heard that physics is not as hard as some of the previous science classes I have had to take for my major. In that case, I am very relieved. I have a general idea of the concept of physics but I am sure throughout this class, that will change.

Jordaan Render Phys 102 Reflection 1 Why am I here?  I am here because I want to receive a quality education around a new group of people and further my academic career as well as personal character development. I chose SFSU because it is a new school in a new city and I thoroughly enjoy meeting new people. I was born in Germany and grew up across the United States on different military bases. Moving around a lot made it easier for me to become an adaptable person and see the culture differences within our own country. I would like to use my background in a way that allows me to me travel and connect with many different people from differing cultures and really gain a broader view on life. I started my college career as a political science major because I used to aspire to be a politician, but later decided that was not the path for me. I subsequently chose computer science because the sciences have always been fascinating to me and I love building and overclocking computers, but after studying CS for a year and turning one of my favorite hobbies into something I have to work hard at, my passion started to die for that field. Luckily, I was able to easily switch to health sciences and I have been pretty content with where I am at so far. My current path is to become a Physical Therapist because I enjoy communicating with and helping people and as a PT, I will have many opportunities to travel for work. In conclusion, I would say I am here for a quality education and to meet new people from different backgrounds.

I've thought a lot about this subject to the point where I know too many different possibilities that it can drown me. I am a rather spiritual person I would say and I am also a curious one and for that reason I've asked a lot of different people a lot of different questions. I've studies with catholics, christians, jehovah witnesses, talked to muslums, mormons just to hear what they have to say. One of the most interesting versions i've heard was that we were all angels that lost our ways and we are living many lives in order to fix the mistakes that we’ve made and in the different life times that we live we are learning different lessons and once we've learned all our lessons that's when we can finally fully rest. I don't know how true that is but i thought it was interesting because if you pay attention to the things that happen around us then you can be really attuned to the things that pop up in your life and why. Molst people live without thinking a single thought and choosing different things that can shape their life and others in different ways. As for why I am here, I have felt that I have always been here for other people. I teach and learn lessons as I go as to what my purpose is. I think I'm still on my way of figuring that out as the rest of us are. And I don't think anyone actually knows a definite answer considering there is no actual difference between me and the next person we are still on this same planet. I'm not worried about the what happens next either because at the end of the day it is inevitable, and i try not to think about the what i'm supposed to do for now as much because it can really put you in a helpless state, so i'm just trying to trust my intuition and flow to where life takes me.

Why am I here?     I believe that I am here to help others since I have always grown up taking care of my   grandparents and siblings. I always knew that I had a strong passion for inspiring and motivating   others to do their best, but I never truly had an idea of what career path I wanted to take. After   taking different classes in community college, I found myself very interested in the Kinesiology   field and I remember watching a short clip in class about the different career paths. When the   video showed what a day would look like as an occupational therapist, I was truly inspired by   her work and how much her patients meant to her. Right away, I did more research on what an   OT does and ever since, I continued taking more classes and hope to attend OT grad school   after I graduate with a BS in Kinesiology. I believe that I am here to also make my parents proud   and most importantly, to make myself proud. I also want to have a family in the future and be   able to take care and provide for them, so I want to have a good job that will help me become   financially stable in the near future.

Why am I here? I am here in Physics 102 to complete as one of my requirements towards my major. Even though Physics isn’t particularly my favorite go to subject, I am finding it more and more interesting as we move forward. I am here to accomplish the classes I need in order to be successful in my career which will be Kinesiology. I am here to learn about the body and movements in order to help others become healthier and stronger. I am here at this university to help me further my education and to be able to have bachelor’s degree to hold a successful job. Those are some of the reasons on why I am here and why I am enrolled in taking the Physics 102 lab.   -Rebekah Schroeder

I am here because I never took the physics lab portion of the class until now 2 years after taking   the course originally. So one advice I would give is to study the material   outside of the class and be curious about some of the things brought up in lecture. You’d be   amazed at what can be learned. The physics course was an overall good experience as well as   I remember a lot of problems that were solved with the professor doing presentations.

The reason why I’m in this Physics lab is because I need the lab part of this course. Hopefully I’ll   learn something useful that I can use later in the future or present. I think labs are about looking   in depth after having a result or data in order to prove your answer, so by taking this lab I can   learn to elaborate more and expand my thoughts. It's also a new learning experience since it's   an online lab course where we get to use different methods.

I am here because this class is a prerequisite for my Kinesiology major. I don’t really know much   about physics and the last physics class I took was in middle school. I’m here because I want to   have an education and build my career/ find my passion. I’m here because I have to be. I’m   actually not sure why I’m here. I’m here because many people my age are in college working   towards their dream jobs but I feel like I’m just here. Sometimes, I have a quarter-life crisis and   I’m not even 25 years old yet. I’ve been having a quarter-life crisis since I was in high school.   People tell me that I’m still young and that I’ll figure things out soon but I don’t like not   knowing what’s going to happen in my future. I don’t even know what my passion is. I enjoy   going to the gym which is why I’m a Kinesiology major. I also don’t find other majors   interesting. I think I want to go into occupational therapy but I don’t know if I’m even able to be   accepted by a graduate school. I can’t see myself as anything and I’m just stuck or I’m actually   just not sure where I’m going or if I’m going down the right path. I’m kind of confused. I’m here   because my sisters are also here and they mean a lot to me.

Why am I here?     I am here at school because I want to become a nurse, and that requires a license and degree. I   am currently a kinesiology major so I can transfer into the nursing program either here or at   another school. I feel passionate about helping others that if I could, I would want to be a doctor.   I love the excitement, the knowledge, and the help I would put towards others as a nurse.   The general reason towards why I’m here is because of my parents. They put me in this world   even though my mom always said she could have dropped me off at the fire department. She was   kidding. I love my family and my life, and I don’t regret being where I am at. I always wanted to   die doing something heroic and making my last words something a long the lines of “I got this”.

Ahries Julian                                           Physics 102 reflection 1     Why am I here? I am here attending SFSU to achieve higher education but also to hopefully find   a career. One reason that I am taking physics is because I need to for my major courses to   graduate and achieve my bachelor of science degree in exercise science and movement   science. After getting my bachelor of science degree in kinesiology, I plan to hopefully apply for   physical therapy school or occupational therapy school. My mind has not been made up yet if I   wanted to go to medical school etc. Since I am a personal trainer and have been coaching   clients in different populations for about 4 ½ years, I feel this is my passion and my calling.   Anything can happen though till I graduate so I do have time to reflect and process everything in   my mind to make the best decision for myself and future.

Why am I here ?     I am here in this class at least to gain more knowledge on a science subject that I am very  limited in. I want to learn more about how the world moves and the forces in it. Being a  kinesiology major we study the bodies and how they move. When a body is in motion many  forces are acting upon them. This class hopefully will help me understand those forces and  allow me to better help a patient. I really am I here because it is a requirement for my major  otherwise, I would have avoided this if I am being complet ely honest. So far I like the lecture  class because it has some real world applications. The lab I enjoy as well because we have the  breakout groups and they let me work with other students, makes me almost feel like I am in  class again.
